noun.description: A sudden brief burst of bright flame or light.
examples: the flare of the match lit up his face

noun.description: A gradual widening, especially of a skirt or pants.
examples: as you knit, add a flare or curve a hem
the bonfire crackled and flared up
the blaze across the water flared

verb.description: Gradually become wider at one end.
examples: the dress flared out into a huge train

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense spread out one's hair): of unknown origin. Current senses date from the 17th century.
